He went up the stairs of the dungeon into the courtyard where he met a tall woman, about 5' 7'', in an orange velvet dress with knots, spirals and intricate key patterns woven into the sleeves hanging from her wrist and along the neckline and hem of her dress with silver threads. She had fire-colored hair and grayish blue eyes. The guards said, "You have been assigned to her. She is your new mistress," and then left.

"Come with me," she said softly. Walking behind her, you entered into her study. Then she pointed to an alcove, with a chair and a plate of beef stew and a mug of beer set on a small table.

"I've set aside some of my leftovers for you to eat. I hope you enjoy them!" she exclaimed.

Happy that he had found a kind mistress, Kendall went into the alcove to eat and drink. The stew and the mug of beer were deeply satisfying after the stale bread and filthy water served in the dungeon. After he ate, he arose with satisfication, from having a good meal. Then he began to feel dizzy. Then the sensation of shrinking began as he shrank to the size of an imp.

"Help me, I've been bewitched!" shouted the unfortunate Kendall. Yet his mistress merely grinned as she approached him. "The experimental potion worked!" crowed Ena. Bending down she picked up the shrunken Kendall.

As she held him in her fist, Ena continued, "You know there is so much fun I can have with you, little man. I can show you off to my friends as a pet, lock you up and take out my bad moods on you and play games with you. If you bore me, I can squish you like a bug or feed you to one of this castle's attack dogs!"

Just then, a woman in a red velvet dress with knots, spirals and intricate key patterns woven into the sleeves hanging from her wrist and along the neckline and hem of her dress with gold threads entered the study. She had red hair and green eyes.

"Hello, Gale, how are you doing?" asked Kendall's captress.

Kendall shouted, "I was a normal-sized man until this crazy woman shrank me. Help me!"

132.content:
Gale slipped Kendall into the pocket of her dress and swept from the room. Kendall bumped along in her pocket and contemplated his situation. He was lying face down and struggled upright to gain a sitting position, as a man might in a hammock.

"Out of the frying pan" he muttered to himself.

He rummaged in his own pockets - empty. His gaolers had been very thorough in relieving him of his possessions. He stared around his new surroundings and mentally noted the inventory.

A folded kerchief, doubtless made of a fine material but the size of a heavy tarpaulin to a man of Kendalls reduced frame.

And a key that would be small to a human - perhaps for a trinket box or small safe. It bounced alarmingly as Gale walked and Kendall struggled backwards to maintain a distance between himself and it.

Just as Kendall was starting to feel sea sick, the movement abruptly stopped.

Voices.

"Your majesty." Gales voice. Kendall winced as he dropped and then rose again. A curtsey.

"Gale. I trust you have everything you need?". Kendall froze. The queen's voice.

"I do now your majesty."

"Good day Gale, remember your promise."

"Yes ma'am." Another curtsey.

The motion started again. Stairs Kendall guessed, then a passage way, a door opened and closed, stopped again.

Gale reached into her pocket and plucked Kendall out. She placed him on top of a tall chest so that he was on a level with her. She looked him over carefully, Kendall stared back.

They were in what Kendall took to be Gale's personal chambers, every bit as grand as those belonging to Ena.

"First things first" said Gale and began to remove her dress.

Kendall considered his circumstances. He was on a tall chest - could he jump and run? He'd heard that a mouse could fall a great distance and survive - would the same be true for him in his shrunken form? Somehow he couldn't bring himself to try the jump from the chest. He turned his attention to Gale who was now stripped to her nether clothes and was rummaging in a cupboard.

She re-emerged clutching a silver dish and a large glass phial.

"Need to undo the pimple curse before it takes hold" she explained over her shoulder.

Kendall grimaced inwardly. Any other time he'd have been delighted to watch a woman in her nether clothes; he didn't even want to think about the size of his fruits now!

Gale emptied the phial into the dish, muttering under her breath. She then proceeded to wash her face, neck and shoulders from the dish.

"Can you undo the curse on me too?" asked Kendall, his voice reedy and high to his own ears.

"I ______________________________" replied Gale with a smile.

Just then, Lady Helga, the Witch Constable of Connalk popped out of the wall, dressed like a shieldmaiden of the Norse.

Helga set Gale and Kendall on the Queen’s lap in her chamber. Helga had changed out of her armor into a long dress.

Gale and Kendall immediately tried to run away and were immediately stopped by the firm but gentle movement of Deirdre’s hands.

“What’s wrong? I’m your big friend, you silly poppets,” laughed Deirdre. “All of us are your big friends. We want to take care of you little poppet people.”

Gale was furious. “Don’t listen to her. She had us shrunken; we can’t let her brainwash us, too!”

Deirdre shifted Gale from her left hand to her right hand with Kendall.

“Shrink you? Brainwash you? But you’ve always been poppets and we’ve always been your big friends,” cooed Deirdre, as she played a harp with her left hand. “We love you and we’re concerned that you’re scaring yourself with these horrible delusions.”

Meanwhile the obfuscating scent candles worked their magic, as Deirdre, Ena and Helga had intended, when they had made them in the meeting of their coven of witches.

“You love me? You’re concerned about me? You threatened me! ‘You shouldn't have crossed me, bitch!’” Gale objected.

Deirdre frowned. “I’m sorry to have fueled your delusions, dearie. You two are such bratty little poppets that sometimes I say things that I shouldn’t. But I really adore you cute little poppet people!”

Deirdre released Gale and Kendall from her hand. “You see, Kendall’s sleeping off his troubles. You should too.”

Struggling against Deirdre’s enchantment, Gale squealed, “No! You will NOT brainwash me! I am NOT your toy!” as she ran to Deirdre’s knee and slid down her long dress.

With a laugh, Deirdre picked up the hem of her long dress and raised it, catching Gale in the bend.

In a concerned, maternal voice, Deirdre pleaded, “My dear little poppet, please sleep off your delusions! You’ll feel much better. I promise!”

“But, but…” Gale objected, as Deirdre put her back on her lap.

Deirdre stroked Gale with her finger, as she intensified the playing of the harp.

Deirdre gently picked up the sleeping shrinkees and wrapped them in a soft green rag, with her coat of arms on it. She petted both of their heads.

15312.content:
The black-haired pale-skinned 13-yr.-old princess, the Archduchess Amelia Gwyneth Julia, took after her mother, the black-haired pale-skinned Empress Gwyneth in more than just looks. The Empress Gwyneth and her daughter, Archduchess Amelia Gwyneth Julia (13), enjoyed acting out the role of giantess to their little doll family (Gale and Kendall and their three sons, 13, 10 and 8. Amelia is attracted to the eldest but her mother tells her not to get too obsessed by a mere doll-man.), especially at tea parties for Amelia. In her brainwashed delirium, Gale remarks on how amazing it was when the giantesses lifted up heavy teapots and tea cups—in reality, fine china—causing the giantesses to laugh and pet her little head. For her part, the Empress, frequently wearing a purple hat and a purple coat with two breast pockets and two lower pockets over a purple dress, had the notorious habit of leaving Gale to wait on her in one of her four coat pockets for eight hours straight interrupted only for mealtime and toilet breaks.

Opening the door to the doll chamber, the young princess looked at the doll house inside.

“How’s my favorite redheaded doll-girl doing?” she cooed, as she reached down to pick Gale off the balcony of her doll-house. With a stern expression on her face, Gale shot the fingertips of Amelia’s right hand with fire.

“Go away and don’t come back until you get your mother. I would like a word with her, bitch!”

Amelia frowned and ran out of the doll chamber. “Mommy, Gale’s acting mean! She shot my fingertips with fire!”

Gwyneth got up off her imperial throne with concern. Ever since, her student Helga had sent her other student and niece Deirdre’s rebellious courtier Gale to her, she had made sure to keep Gale under an enchantment. For the first time in 15 years, she had forgotten to do so.

Entering the doll chamber, she looked down at the angry, little Gale. “Now, now, little girl, it’s not nice to shoot people with fire. Here, let me calm you down!” she exclaimed, as she reached down and picked up Gale.

info.brief_description: a young man falls into the hand of a powerful sorceress
info.description:
First things first: After you read my story, could you please add to it? Or tell me what you thought of it? I'd really appreciate it. And now, about the story itself:

For years the rival kingdoms of Connalk and Mektlacaugh have fought over the disputed Valley of Thogmond. Both kingdoms have raided each other's villages in the region, capturing cattle, gold and slaves. The Queen of Connalk is winning a string of victories through employing a coven of witches to supplement her army. In one of her army's successful raids, the peasant militiaman Kendall was captured and handed over to the sorceress Ena as a slave. Ena slipped an experimental potion into her new slave's beer mug, shrinking him to the size of an imp. Now the unfortunate Kendall hopes that Ena's colleague Gale will save him before he dies due to one of Ena's twisted games!

When adding to the story, don't have Kendall restored to his normal size or killed, at least for eight chapters. Even if Gale saves him, it will take time to find an antidote to Ena's experimental potion! Also if Gale restores Kendall's size, there is still the issue of whether Kendall can be released seeing as he is a captured soldier.

Characters

Deirdre is both the Queen of the Kingdom of Connalk and one of the kingdom’s tallest women at 6’ tall. Her formal dress is a dark green velvet dress with emeralds embroidered into the fabric. Two emeralds are embroidered into the corner of each of the wrists of her dress, plus an emerald on the each side of the sleeves hanging from her wrist. While these emeralds are small, bigger emeralds are embroidered along the neckline and hem of her dress. She has long black hair and black eyes.

Ena is a tall woman, about 5' 7''. Her formal clothes is an orange velvet dress with knots, spirals and intricate key patterns woven into the sleeves hanging from her wrist and along the neckline and hem of her dress with silver threads. She had fire-colored hair and grayish blue eyes.

Gale is taller than Ena at about 5’ 9”. Her formal clothes is a red velvet dress with knots, spirals and intricate key patterns woven into the sleeves hanging from her wrist and along the neckline and hem of her dress with gold threads. She had red hair and green eyes.

Kendall is a peasant militiaman captured by the raiders of the Army of Connalk. He’ll take risks but only after thinking through on what to do next. He has spent all his time in his home village in the Valley of Thogmond. His parents and most of his relatives from their generation have died from a combination of old age, malnutrition and overwork like many of their fellow peasants. His younger relatives have fled from his home village due to the successes of the Queen of Connalk. He himself is 20 years old and cannot afford a wife, even if he had a lover—which he does not because he is somewhat shy and unassuming.
